"Ow!" a voice said. Lily looked down and saw a small, furry cat. It had the same markings as the stamp. It looked at her with big, green eyes.
"Who are you?" Lily asked.
"I'm Stampy. I was a stamp, but you made me alive with your dream. Thank you, Lily. Can I be your friend?" the cat said.

. As she was eating it, she noticed a butterfly zip by. She chased it, and the sandwich flew out of her hands and landed in a big puddle of mud.
Lily was embarrassed. She had nothing to eat and the butterfly had gone. She began to cry.
Just then, Lily heard a voice. It belonged to a kind old man. 
"Don't cry, little one," he said. "Let me buy you another sandwich."
Lily felt much better and thanked the old man. She zipped off, delighted to have a new sandwich.

, one day Sally decided to go for a walk in the woods.
As Sally was walking, she noticed a big and impressive tree. She found a seat on the tree and sat down. Suddenly, she heard a noise and looked around.
To her surprise, she saw a bright and colourful lizard! Sally was so excited! She wanted to be friends with the lizard and take it home.
The lizard did not want to go home with Sally, so she respected its decision. Instead of trying to capture the lizard, she offered to take care of it and its home.
This story teaches us to respect the decisions of others

Tommy was walking through the forest with his mommy. He saw a lamp peeking out from behind a big tree. He knew that he was not supposed to take things and he was not allowed to go near strange things, so he stopped and asked his mommy.
"Mommy, what is this strange thing?"
"It looks like a lamp," his mommy said. "But we don't know what it is doing here, so be careful and don't touch it."
But Tommy was curious so he inched a bit closer to take a better look. The lamp seemed quite interesting and he wanted to pick

pie. She heard a loud voice behind her and jumped.
"What are you up to?" her grandpa asked.
"Making a pie for morning," Mary replied.

Peter replied, "It's a pan. I'm taking it home."

The intelligent soldier took Lily's hand and started walking with her. They walked and walked until they found Lily's house. Her mom and dad were so happy to see her. They thanked the soldier and invited him for dinner. From that day on, the soldier and Lily's family became good friends.

to find somewhere to be safe. Everywhere she looked, the world seemed so big and she was so small. So she decided to rush away and look for a safe place to hide.
Lily ran and ran, but she couldn't find anywhere to take shelter. Suddenly she heard a quiet sound coming from a nearby cell. She rushed over to take a closer look, and was surprised to find a tiny creature with wings living inside.
The creature was friendly and welcomed her in. Lily was so happy to have found somewhere safe and warm where she felt protected. From then on, Lily came back to visit the cell every day.

, Sam heard a voice. It was his mom, speaking from his warm living room. She said "try the drawer, Sam - you know where it is." Sam opened the drawer, and he saw his mitten inside. He said "thank you!", and then he repeated the same words - thank you, thank you - over and over again.
Then he put on the mitten and continued making his snowman. In the end, it was the biggest, most beautiful snowman he had ever seen!
